top_categories.workout_context: 70ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee's Washington coast, Coastal gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 50 miles.
At Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before July.
Varied gradients on Washington coast gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on Washington coast gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
50 miles on Washington coast gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Low-cadence force work for 3,500ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on Washington coast gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Unravel - Why-Not-Chee requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on washington coast gravel to build confidence. Expect: washington coast, coastal gravel, pacific northwest.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of washington coast gravel in Hoquiam, WA.
